protfolio.heading: My Work
protfolio.description: Best way to truly master something? It's simple - build it yourself! Rather than getting lost in endless amounts of theoretical information that you may never use, take a more hands-on approach. Just like how you can't become a skilled driver by just reading about it, you need to get behind the wheel and experience it for yourself. So, don't just read about it - dive in and build your way to success!

projects.name: Library ERP System
projects.description: Revolutionize the college library game with Python and PyQt5 - the ultimate powerhouse solution for a seamless experience of book tracking, inventory management and more!

content.html: This software designed to manage a complete library of a college using Python and PyQt5 is an efficient and effective solution to streamline the library management process. The software enables users to manage all aspects of the library, including cataloging, searching, borrowing, and returning books.

One of the key features of this software is its user-friendly interface. The GUI developed using PyQt5 provides a simple and intuitive interface that is easy to navigate for users of all skill levels. The interface displays various options, such as search books by title, author, ISBN number, and category, among others.

Another essential feature of the software is its ability to track book borrowing and returning. The software allows library staff to check out books to users and record their details, including the borrower's name, contact details, and due date. Similarly, when the books are returned, the software marks them as returned and removes them from the borrower's account.

Furthermore, the software enables library staff to manage book inventory efficiently. Users can add new books to the library catalog, edit existing books, and delete books that are no longer in circulation.

Overall, This software provides a comprehensive solution to manage a complete college library. Its intuitive interface, book tracking, and inventory management capabilities make it a valuable tool for librarians and users alike.
Note: Don't not use for commercial purpose.

projects.name: Sword Animation
projects.description: I dabbled in the world of 3D animation by creating a stunning masterpiece using Blender. It was my way of exploring ray tracing, color, lighting, and particles, and boy did I learn a lot!

content.html: The sword animation that I have created using Blender and incorporating lightning, ray-tracing, and particle system sounds impressive. With the use of ray tracing, I was able to create realistic lighting and shadows that added a polished and professional look to my animation. The addition of lightning effects added to the drama and intensity of the action. The particle system was used to simulate debris or sparks as the sword moved or struck an object, making the animation more dynamic and realistic. Overall, the combination of techniques used in this animation created a visually stunning and impressive piece of work. Well done!

projects.name: Flappy Bird
projects.description: I developed this game using the Pygame module in Python, but I coded everything from scratch instead of relying on Pygame's built-in functions. I only used Pygame for its basic functionality.

skills.description: Learning and success go hand in hand, and the graph is exponential! Once you've mastered the basics, tackling advanced concepts is a breeze. No trouble, no stress - just pure progress.
skills.description1: Listen up, folks - the graph of learning and success is exponential! And here's a little secret: once you've got the basics and core concepts of something down pat, learning the advanced stuff will be a piece of cake. No more struggling or feeling overwhelmed - with a solid foundation in place, you'll be able to take on even the most complex concepts with ease. So, don't shy away from those advanced topics - go ahead and give them a shot! You might just surprise yourself with how much you can handle. After all, when it comes to learning and success, the sky's the limit!
